reference.title: Integration with VS Code
reference.shortdesc: The uses Visual Studio (VS) Code as a plugin that helps in creating, authoring, and configuring the content packs.

section.p: The VS Code helps to author the content which is easier for users to get onboarded to the platform.

The icons added in the VS Code after you install are:
- Altair One Tool icon
- Altair One Content Pack icon. Content pack is an encapsulation of various Definitions, Events, Actions and Event Hook combined.

The VS Code provides the following panel:
Left Panel – which is the authoring panel to define a workflow for authoring a content pack and it consists of:
Top pane - Remote Packs that are deployed on the server Top pane - Remote Packs
Middle pane - Local Packs that are authored by the user Middle pane - Local Packs
Bottom pane - Content Outline Bottom pane - Content Outline
Right Panel – to author the content pack
